alert.note: Alert for Custer County Plains; Pine Ridge Area (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 19 at 2:55AM MDT until September 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .Unseasonably warm temperatures are expected today. Minimum relative humidity will be around 15 percent for much of the area...with portions of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota dropping to near 10 percent. Deep boundary layer mixing will result in gusty west-southwest winds this afternoon/early evening. Wind gusts over 30 mph are possible for much of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota. While winds decrease this evening, relative humidity will be slow to recover this evening/tonight; maximum relative for areas around the Black Hills will be 45 percent or less. A cold front slides through the area tonight/early Tuesday with a period of gusty northwest winds behind the front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 325 AND 326... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 325 Custer County Plains and 326 Pine Ridge Area. * WINDS...West 5 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Custer County Plains; Pine Ridge Area
